comment: My experience has been like the negative reviews said. She created a toxic envrnmt in class. Asked us to send her secret emails about classmts we thought weren't working hard enough on group prjcts so she could take care of it instead of dealing with it ourslvs. Very sneaky way to make us not trust each ther. Very petty and toxic.

I agree with most of the negative comments.  She is demeaning, talks to student as children, makes fun of students that ask questions in class, no grades until you see final overall course grade on Registrar website.  Do not take this lady Katherine Epps.  Terrible person.  Might be my worst professor to date.

Loves to humiliate and put students in their place. Not much of a coach or teacher. She's mean, rude and doesn't get that she's dealing with adults. The class itself is a joke. Lots of b.s. group skits and papers that are probably never read or graded. Even if I could get back the money for this class, I'll never get back my time.

Very ironic that she teaches a class called leadership and professional skills. Thinks professionalism has more to do with wearing pantyhose than treating students with respect. Cannot be bothered to learn to use d2l or to give students feedback on any papers. Does her best to stamp out any spark of leadership or individuality in her classes.
Great teacher.  If you know anything about accounting you will do fine.  You are expected to know some of the basics of accounting going into the class

Teacher was pretty easy and clear.  I missed a week for surgery and I was still able to pull a B easy.  I know at least 3 other people from that class would agree that she is not that bad.  Especially after taking Carver's class!!!

The last comment is mind boggling. I didn't find her disrespectful at all, and have no clue as to what this person is referring to. The class is challenging, but she is always readily available to help students outside of class. The tests and quizzes and overall grading was very fair.

I believed the professor wrote ALL the previous comments.  This class is hell, she is disrespectful, condescending and a straight out B*+^h.  DO NOT take her class EVER, you WILL regret it. Everything is like the others mention, 3 test-1 final, etc. Get ready to learn by your darn self.

Good professor. She is very well versed in accounting and is also good at teaching the material. Stay on track, study, and do the recommended homework problems and you will do well. She will not be teaching after this semester as she is now the Chair of the Accounting Department but she said she may be able to teach again in the future.
She will not teach the class, you must learn this stuff yourself.

high energy, hella hard 3 exams and 1 final,2 graded assignments w/1 week to do, 5 quizzes.  must read book.  has mutiple choice exams with a couple problem questions at end (these will kick your ass b/c she won't specifiy which to study for) she says lowest quiz is dropped when actually it's extra credit in end.
Very enthusatic teacher! Her class is hard but very useful. Be ready to study a lot. Always willing to help out of class. Understanding.
She was not that hard.  You have to work, but if you did, you got a good grade. Take her, she makes it fun.

Dr. Epps is an excellent professor.  The class is not easy and you must read the book and complete all homework.  A lot of work but Dr. Epps is fair.  You must earn your grades.  If you are not willing to work hard...Stay away from Dr. Epps classes.  Good luck.

I think these people are bookworms. You will learn a lot in her class, yes, but if you want an A for getting A's on the tests bc you know the material inside and out, Do NOT take her. She has 2 projects that she grades as she sees fit. She never changes ur grade and is very unhelpful when asked Qs. She    actually never worked as an accountant.

Kathy Epps is a phenomenal teacher... one of the best I've ever had.  She's fair (not too easy, not too hard), and she truly desires success for each of her students.  It's obvious that she loves accounting and teaching.  Take this class if you want to enjoy 3100 AND learn at the same time.  I recommend her class to ANYONE.

Dr. Epps is an outstanding professor. Suggestions for taking her class: 1-go to class and listen to her lectures 2-do all the assigned homework (tests come straight from the homework). This is a difficult class that I believe no other professor could teach as well or with as much enthusiasm. Highly recommend Dr. Epps.

Dr. Epps knows her stuff and is an excellent teacher. Overall very demanding class. Fast paced and a lot of reading. There are 5 in class quizzes, 5 take home assignments, and 3 exams plus a final. The exams are very tough. You must know the material for the exam and be quick with the answers as the exams will take entire period (even the final).

Come in ready to work, work, work! She knows her stuff and doesn't take excuses at all. If there is a deadline you better make it, or you will get a zero. If you have a question you better ask or come test time you will fail. During tests you better structure your time wisely or you will not finish the test which will result in a low test average.
She is a very good teacher. She knows whats shes talking about and trys to make accounting fun and exciting.
Very fair teacher.  Very enthusatic about her classes and the opportunity to teach.  Highly recommend.
